I forgot how much I loved this movie and the actors. It had a great plot full of twists and turns
This movie is slow in some places but at least they explain what's going on by the middle so you're notnstill scratching your head.

Full on suspense with plenty of ideas thrown in to keep you guessing,  marvellous acting from all and not knowing what's next makes this a masterpiece well worth an A grade plus rating. Holding you from beginning to the very end you can't find any better movie than this. So the story is about a man who loses his wife and daughter in an airplane crash but finds out there were survivors a child about 6 years old the same age as his daughter and a woman. So he goes looking for them and as the journey continues he is thrown into a strange and unknown society that won't tell him everything because of the danger surrounding them. From who are they running from and who is the woman who keeps him away from his child with people chasing him and her this gets better as it goes along. Now I have told you a little bit as there is a lot more to this, now to keep you interested I'll leave you hanging in mid air as not to totally disappoint you and tell all. So now it's time for the show to begin and you to collect the munchies and show sit with feet up, relax to a fabulous night in with a first class entertainment movie from the past.  Enjoy!
ok
One of the better film adaptations of Koontz's books.

Here's one where you go from super natural to believeable.  Dean Koontz's best-selling novel is brought to TV in this 4 hour mini-series. After the death of his wife and daughter in a plane crash, a newspaper reporter discovers that the crash may have been related to a nefarious scientific experiment involving children.
great
The DVD was a gift for a friend out of state, so I can't really speak to how good it was.
Great movie based on a novel by Dean Koontz.

But the book is soooooo much better.  No movie can possibly give you the depth of character and background like a book.  And sometimes key characters and plot twists need to trimmed. removed or glossed over to fit into the time constraints and attention span of moviegoers.  Read the book first, the see the movie.
Read the book--loved the DVD.  Way to go Dean Koontz.

The movie wasn't as good as I'd hoped. I've never read the book, so I don't know how true it stays to the plot, but I only watched it through because I was hoping that it'd get better. I feel like I wasted my time.
Great movie.
everything went well

Husband loved this Hard to Find movie. Fast Safe Delivery. I read Dean Koontz's books for years and the movie actually close to the book. Will buy from Hofmann Isabella again and again.
